com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.cluster

Class HAContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.cluster.HAContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IClusterState, IHAContext, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable

    public final class HAContext
extends ComponentHelper
implements IHAContext, IClusterState
    This is the main entry point to the HA sub-system.

    A single instance of that class is created and configured by the configuration loader and is bound in the runtime registry to the name given by NameUtils.highAvailabilityClusterName() . Its component's ComponentHelper.openComponent() and setComponentActive(boolean) methods are then called by the application when it gets respectively opened and activated.

      The start-up sequence of the HA context is as follows: Start the communication layer. Start operation marshallers so we are able to service any operation invoked on us by other cluster nodes as soon as we join the group. Start the group controller and join the distributed group with role S. Sit there for groupAgeThreshold * groupPublishPeriod so that once we have finished waiting we have a reliable view of who else is there.       • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Configures the HA context.

        This implementation implicitly assumes that it is never reconfigured.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface IConfigurable
        Overrides:
        configure in class ComponentHelper
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if configuration is not an HighAvailabilityClusterConfiguration
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.
        See Also:
        IConfigurable.configure(IConfiguration)

      • setComponentActive

        public boolean setComponentActive(boolean active)
                           throws Exception
        The start-up sequence of the HA context is as follows:
        1. Start the communication layer.
        2. Start operation marshallers so we are able to service any operation invoked on us by other cluster nodes as soon as we join the group.
        3. Start the group controller and join the distributed group with role S.
        4. Sit there for groupAgeThreshold * groupPublishPeriod so that once we have finished waiting we have a reliable view of who else is there.
        5. Compare this cluster node's software revision with that of other cluster nodes. Any discrepancy here leads to a failure.
        6. Compare this cluster node's HA configuration with that of other cluster nodes. Any discrepancy here leads to a failure.
        7. Compare this cluster node's configuration with that of other cluster nodes and report any discrepancy as a warning.
        8. Register a command-line processor.
        9. Initialize the Distributed Collection Registry so that it can provide support for replicating and synchronizing distributed collections. The Distributed Collection Registry is created first thing by the application because it needs to be there when components that need distributed collections are created (persisters for example). But it can only be fully configured for distribution once we have read the HA configuration and started the communication layer.
        10. Start the synchronization controller. This will cause the role determination state machine to start as soon as the synchronization controller reports that we are synchronized with the rest of the cluster.
        The shut-down sequence is as follows:
        1. Compare this cluster node's configuration with that of other cluster nodes and report any discrepancy as a warning.
        2. Stop the role determination state machine.
        3. Stop the synchronization controller.
        4. Stop the communication group.
        5. Stop operation marshallers.
        6. Stop the communication layer.
        Specified by:
        setComponentActive in interface IComponent
        Overrides:
        setComponentActive in class ComponentHelper
        Parameters:
        active - New active state.
        Returns:
        Previous active state.
        Throws:
        Exception - Never.
        See Also:
        ComponentHelper.setComponentActive(boolean)

      • localNodeCanBecomePrimary

        public boolean localNodeCanBecomePrimary()
        Description copied from interface: IHAContext
        Tells whether is currently possible to force the local cluster node to become primary. There are a few reasons why this may not be the case:
        • If the local HA role determination state machine is still in the process of determining what the role of the local cluster node is.
        • If the local cluster node is already primary.
        Specified by:
        localNodeCanBecomePrimary in interface IHAContext
        Returns:
        true iff. it is currently possible to force the local cluster node to become primary
        See Also:
        IHAContext.localNodeCanBecomePrimary()
